events.title: Brazil Becomes a Republic
events.description: The Empire of Brazil was officially abolished and the country was declared a republic, marking the end of the monarchy under Emperor Pedro II.
events.significance: This event transformed Brazil's political landscape, initiating the Brazilian Republic era and influencing its modern governance.

events.title: League of Nations Holds Its First Assembly
events.description: The League of Nations convened its inaugural assembly in Geneva, Switzerland, aiming to promote peace and cooperation following World War I.
events.significance: The League represented the first major international effort to maintain global peace and prevent future conflicts.

events.title: UN Passes Resolution on Palestine
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly recognized the rights of the Palestinian people and granted observer status to the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO).
events.significance: This resolution marked a significant step in international recognition of Palestinian representation and rights.

events.title: First Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade
events.description: The inaugural Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade was held in New York City, becoming an annual tradition with large floats, balloons, and performances.
events.significance: The parade became an iconic American cultural event, symbolizing the start of the holiday season.
